articles.headline: Rahm Emanuel, Chicago’s Rough-Edged Mayor, Tries the Sandpaper
articles.snippet: As a runoff with Jesus G. Garcia approaches next Tuesday, some voters say they have soured on hardball tactics and gruffness.
articles.abstract: As a runoff with Jesus G. Garcia approaches next Tuesday, some voters say they have soured on hardball tactics and gruffness.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Alderman Scott Waguespack was in a conference room at City Hall in the spring of 2011 for a formal sit-down with this city’s newly elected mayor, Rahm Emanuel. Mr. Waguespack attempted some small talk, he said, but Mr. Emanuel was not much interested.

articles.headline: China Appears to Attack GitHub by Diverting Web Traffic
articles.snippet: The attack on GitHub, a code library that includes methods for viewing Internet sites blocked in China, comes as the country has increased its censorship.
articles.abstract: The attack on GitHub, a code library that includes methods for viewing Internet sites blocked in China, comes as the country has increased its censorship.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The Chinese government has long used a sophisticated set of Internet filters known as the Great Firewall as a barrier to prevent its citizens from obtaining access to foreign websites with information it deems threatening.

articles.headline: Greece Looks to Russia as Deal With Europe Stumbles
articles.snippet: A meeting next week between Greece’s prime minister and Russia’s president raises questions as European leaders said a reform plan had fallen short.
articles.abstract: A meeting next week between Greece’s prime minister and Russia’s president raises questions as European leaders said a reform plan had fallen short.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — With the prospect of a default looming in Greece, Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is preparing to meet next week with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia as a European deal to give more aid to Athens falters.

articles.headline: Jay Z Reveals Plans for Tidal, a Streaming Music Service
articles.snippet: In a business where artists seldom have direct control over how their work is consumed, musicians will be the majority owners of the company.
articles.abstract: In a business where artists seldom have direct control over how their work is consumed, musicians will be the majority owners of the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Jay Z sees it, there is a clear solution to the problems facing musicians in the streaming age. They should band together — behind him, of course.

articles.headline: Movement to Increase McDonald’s Minimum Wage Broadens Its Tactics
articles.snippet: Unions in the United States and elsewhere are increasing pressure on the fast-food giant by protesting its corporate practices to government bodies as well as planning strikes.
articles.abstract: Unions in the United States and elsewhere are increasing pressure on the fast-food giant by protesting its corporate practices to government bodies as well as planning strikes.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — On a recent Friday, Kwanza Brooks, a $7.25-an-hour McDonald’s worker, climbed into a 14-person van to take a four-hour ride from Charlotte, N.C., to Atlanta.

articles.headline: Prosecutors Scrutinize Minority Borrowers’ Auto Loans
articles.snippet: Government officials say auto sellers are singling out minority borrowers and extending them the costliest car loans, which could exacerbate some neighborhoods’ economic distress.
articles.abstract: Government officials say auto sellers are singling out minority borrowers and extending them the costliest car loans, which could exacerbate some neighborhoods’ economic distress.
articles.lead_paragraph: Minority borrowers were once starved for credit through redlining — banks’ refusal to provide mortgages in their communities.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: As U.S. and Iran Seek Nuclear Deal, Saudi Arabia Makes Its Own Moves
articles.snippet: The talks themselves are already changing the dynamics of regional politics as Saudi Arabia, Iran’s chief regional rival, acts against Iranian-backed groups in Yemen, Syria and Iraq.
articles.abstract: The talks themselves are already changing the dynamics of regional politics as Saudi Arabia, Iran’s chief regional rival, acts against Iranian-backed groups in Yemen, Syria and Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — As America talks to Iran, Saudi Arabia is lashing out against it.

articles.headline: Role of Illness in Germanwings Crash Raises Worry About Stigma
articles.snippet: The intense focus on the co-pilot’s mental illness has raised concerns that it could stigmatize mentally ill people and make it harder to identify troubled workers.
articles.abstract: The intense focus on the co-pilot’s mental illness has raised concerns that it could stigmatize mentally ill people and make it harder to identify troubled workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: An intense focus on the role of the co-pilot’s mental illness in the Germanwings jetliner crash has raised concerns that it risks unfairly stigmatizing millions of people with mental disorders and making it less likely they will seek treatment. That, in turn, could make it even harder to identify people working in high-risk professions who pose a threat to public safety.

articles.headline: Charter Communications’ Bid for Cable Rival Bright House Networks Among Last Merger Wave
articles.snippet: Charter’s $10.4 billion bid for Bright House is the latest big merger announced as corporations in sectors including technology, media and health care seek to combine.
articles.abstract: Charter’s $10.4 billion bid for Bright House is the latest big merger announced as corporations in sectors including technology, media and health care seek to combine.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the cable business, the big keep getting bigger.
articles.byline: By Emily Steel and David Gelles

articles.headline: Bills on ‘Religious Freedom’ Upset Capitols in Arkansas and Indiana
articles.snippet: As Arkansas passed its own measure, Indiana’s governor responded to growing criticism by those who say the legislation could be used to discriminate against gay couples.
articles.abstract: As Arkansas passed its own measure, Indiana’s governor responded to growing criticism by those who say the legislation could be used to discriminate against gay couples.
articles.lead_paragraph: LITTLE ROCK, Ark. — The Arkansas legislature on Tuesday passed its version of a bill described by proponents as a religious freedom law, even as Indiana’s political leaders struggled to gain control over a growing backlash that has led to calls to boycott the state because of criticism that its law could be a vehicle for discrimination against gay couples.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Richard Pérez-Peña

articles.headline: In Nigeria’s Election, Muhammadu Buhari Defeats Goodluck Jonathan
articles.snippet: Mr. Buhari, a former military strongman, defeated Mr. Jonathan, whose government has been criticized for its handling of an Islamist insurgency and sinking economy.
articles.abstract: Mr. Buhari, a former military strongman, defeated Mr. Jonathan, whose government has been criticized for its handling of an Islamist insurgency and sinking economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: KANO, Nigeria — With anger swelling over corruption, inequality and a devastating Islamist insurgency in the nation’s north, Nigerians by a wide margin chose an austere former general who once ruled with an iron hand to be their next president, according to election results on Tuesday.
